abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Petroleum Exploration
            Project for Pakistan was satisfactory. The project achieved
            its main objectives, its impact has been significant,
            sustainability is likely, and the Bank's performance
            was satisfactory while the Borrower's was mixed.
            Several lessons can be learned from this project. First, it
            is important to utilize consultants for technical
            assistance, especially in potentially complicated areas such
            as field operations and seismic analysis. Second, it is
            important to establish a realistic implementation schedule.
            It will help to eliminate the unnecessary expenditure of
            administrative time to negotiate and approve loan
            extensions. Third, there is a need for better quality
            control both in acquisition and processing. It will also
            require staff training in overall petroleum work. Lastly,
            since not all the promoted concessions have been taken for
            exploration, it is recommended that OGDC approach the Bank
            for follow up projects of this nature that include
            acquisition of seismic data, promotion of concessions, and
            training programs for OGDC professionals in new technology
            for data acquisition processing and interpretation.
